verses.esv:
7   The rich rules over the poor,
    and the borrower is the slave of the lender.
verses.kjv: 7 The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
verses.niv: 7 The rich rule over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

verses.esv: 8 Owe no one anything, except to love each other, for the one who loves another has fulfilled the law.
verses.kjv: 8 Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law.
verses.niv: 8 Let no debt remain outstanding, except the continuing debt to love one another, for he who loves his fellowman has fulfilled the law.

verses.esv: 19 And my God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.
verses.kjv: 19 But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
verses.niv: 19 And my God will meet all your needs according to his glorious riches in Christ Jesus.

verses.esv:
9   Honor the LORD with your wealth
    and with the firstfruits of all your produce;
verses.kjv: 9 Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
verses.niv: 9 Honor the LORD with your wealth, with the firstfruits of all your crops;

verses.esv:
5   Trust in the LORD with all your heart,
    and do not lean on your own understanding.
6   In all your ways acknowledge him,
    and he will make straight your paths.
verses.kjv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding. 6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
verses.niv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; 6 in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

verses.esv: 23 Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men,
verses.kjv: 23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.niv: 23 Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men,

verses.esv: 8 But if anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for members of his household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
verses.kjv: 8 But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.
verses.niv: 8 If anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for his immediate family, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.

verses.esv: 7 Pay to all what is owed to them: taxes to whom taxes are owed, revenue to whom revenue is owed, respect to whom respect is owed, honor to whom honor is owed.
verses.kjv: 7 Render therefore to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour.
verses.niv: 7 Give everyone what you owe him: If you owe taxes, pay taxes; if revenue, then revenue; if respect, then respect; if honor, then honor.

verses.esv: 10 Bring the full tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. And thereby put me to the test, says the LORD of hosts, if I will not open the windows of heaven for you and pour down for you a blessing until there is no more need.
verses.kjv: 10 Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse, that there may be meat in mine house, and prove me now herewith, saith the LORD of hosts, if I will not open you the windows of heaven, and pour you out a blessing, that there shall not be room enough to receive it.
verses.niv: 10 Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this," says the LORD Almighty, "and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that you will not have room enough for it.

verses.esv: 28 For which of you, desiring to build a tower, does not first sit down and count the cost, whether he has enough to complete it?
verses.kjv: 28 For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he have sufficient to finish it?
verses.niv: 28 "Suppose one of you wants to build a tower. Will he not first sit down and estimate the cost to see if he has enough money to complete it?

verses.esv:
21   The wicked borrows but does not pay back,
    but the righteous is generous and gives;
verses.kjv: 21 The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again: but the righteous sheweth mercy, and giveth.
verses.niv: 21 The wicked borrow and do not repay, but the righteous give generously;

verses.esv:
20   Precious treasure and oil are in a wise man’s dwelling,
    but a foolish man devours it.
verses.kjv: 20 There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.
verses.niv: 20 In the house of the wise are stores of choice food and oil, but a foolish man devours all he has.

verses.esv:
22   A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children,
    but the sinner’s wealth is laid up for the righteous.
verses.kjv: 22 A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.
verses.niv: 22 A good man leaves an inheritance for his children's children, but a sinner's wealth is stored up for the righteous.

verses.esv:
17   When the righteous cry for help, the LORD hears
    and delivers them out of all their troubles.
18   The LORD is near to the brokenhearted
    and saves the crushed in spirit.
19   Many are the afflictions of the righteous,
    but the LORD delivers him out of them all.
20   He keeps all his bones;
    not one of them is broken.
verses.kjv: 17 The righteous cry, and the LORD heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles. 18 The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit. 19 Many are the afflictions of the righteous: but the LORD delivereth him out of them all. 20 He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
verses.niv: 17 The righteous cry out, and the LORD hears them; he delivers them from all their troubles. 18 The LORD is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit. 19 A righteous man may have many troubles, but the LORD delivers him from them all; 20 he protects all his bones, not one of them will be broken.

verses.esv: 5 Keep your life free from love of money, and be content with what you have, for he has said, “I will never leave you nor forsake you.”
verses.kjv: 5 Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
verses.niv: 5 Keep your lives free from the love of money and be content with what you have, because God has said, "Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you."

verses.esv: 24 “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.
verses.kjv: 24 No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
verses.niv: 24 "No one can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and Money.

verses.esv: 18 You shall remember the LORD your God, for it is he who gives you power to get wealth, that he may confirm his covenant that he swore to your fathers, as it is this day.
verses.kjv: 18 But thou shalt remember the LORD thy God: for it is he that giveth thee power to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he sware unto thy fathers, as it is this day.
verses.niv: 18 But remember the LORD your God, for it is he who gives you the ability to produce wealth, and so confirms his covenant, which he swore to your forefathers, as it is today.

verses.esv: 11 If then you have not been faithful in the unrighteous wealth, who will entrust to you the true riches?
verses.kjv: 11 If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
verses.niv: 11 So if you have not been trustworthy in handling worldly wealth, who will trust you with true riches?

verses.esv: 38 give, and it will be given to you. Good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, will be put into your lap. For with the measure you use it will be measured back to you.”
verses.kjv: 38 Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.
verses.niv: 38 Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you."

verses.esv: 6 For the LORD your God will bless you, as he promised you, and you shall lend to many nations, but you shall not borrow, and you shall rule over many nations, but they shall not rule over you.
verses.kjv: 6 For the LORD thy God blesseth thee, as he promised thee: and thou shalt lend unto many nations, but thou shalt not borrow; and thou shalt reign over many nations, but they shall not reign over thee.
verses.niv: 6 For the LORD your God will bless you as he has promised, and you will lend to many nations but will borrow from none. You will rule over many nations but none will rule over you.

verses.esv: 10 For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evils. It is through this craving that some have wandered away from the faith and pierced themselves with many pangs.
verses.kjv: 10 For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
verses.niv: 10 For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some people, eager for money, have wandered from the faith and pierced themselves with many griefs.

verses.esv: 8 And God is able to make all grace abound to you, so that having all sufficiency in all things at all times, you may abound in every good work.
verses.kjv: 8 And God is able to make all grace abound toward you; that ye, always having all sufficiency in all things, may abound to every good work:
verses.niv: 8 And God is able to make all grace abound to you, so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work.

verses.esv: 33 But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
verses.kjv: 33 But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.niv: 33 But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.

verses.esv: 7 Each one must give as he has decided in his heart, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.
verses.kjv: 7 Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, so let him give; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.
verses.niv: 7 Each man should give what he has decided in his heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.

verses.esv:
11   Wealth gained hastily will dwindle,
    but whoever gathers little by little will increase it.
verses.kjv: 11 Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.
verses.niv: 11 Dishonest money dwindles away, but he who gathers money little by little makes it grow.
